mapping: Persistent acne or cystic breakouts warrant a Dermatology consultation.
Changing shape or color of a mole requires a Dermatology skin cancer screening.
Eczema flare-ups and chronic dry patches are managed by Dermatology.
Psoriasis plaques with silver scales indicate a need for Dermatology.
Unexplained hair loss (alopecia) is treated by Dermatology.
Fungal nail infections (onychomycosis) should be seen by Dermatology.
Rosacea causing facial redness and bumps requires Dermatology care.
Hives (urticaria) lasting more than a few days warrant Dermatology evaluation.
Warts that do not respond to over-the-counter treatment need Dermatology.
Vitiligo (loss of skin pigment) is managed by Dermatology.
Severe dandruff or seborrheic dermatitis is treated by Dermatology.
Painful cysts or boils under the skin require Dermatology.
Suspicious skin lesions or sores that won't heal indicate Dermatology.
Contact dermatitis from allergic reactions is treated by Dermatology.
Keloid scarring after injury requires Dermatology injection therapy.
Shingles rash and blistering should be evaluated by Dermatology or Primary Care.
Excessive sweating (hyperhidrosis) is treated by Dermatology.
Melasma or dark patches on the face warrant Dermatology consultation.
Birthmark evaluation or removal is performed by Dermatology.
Actinic keratosis (rough, scaly patches) requires Dermatology treatment.
ACL tears or knee instability require Orthopedic Surgery evaluation.
Carpal tunnel syndrome causing hand numbness is treated by Orthopedics.
Rotator cuff injuries with shoulder weakness indicate Orthopedics.
Hip arthritis causing groin pain and stiffness requires Orthopedics.
Scoliosis or spinal curvature is managed by Orthopedics.
Bone fractures requiring casting or surgery are handled by Orthopedics.
Chronic ankle instability or severe sprains need Orthopedics.
Tennis elbow (lateral epicondylitis) is treated by Orthopedics.
Plantar fasciitis causing heel pain is managed by Orthopedics or Podiatry.
Meniscus tears causing knee locking require Orthopedics.
Bunions causing foot pain and deformity are treated by Orthopedics.
Herniated discs causing sciatica often require Orthopedics or Neurosurgery.
Osteoporosis-related fractures indicate a need for Orthopedics.
Recurrent shoulder dislocations require Orthopedic stabilization.
Hamstring tears or severe strains are managed by Orthopedics.
Achilles tendonitis or rupture requires Orthopedics.
Trigger finger (locking of the digit) is treated by Orthopedics.
Ganglion cysts on the wrist are removed by Orthopedics.
Shin splints that do not improve with rest need Orthopedics.
Joint replacement consultation is done by Orthopedics.
Cataracts causing cloudy vision are treated by Ophthalmology.
Glaucoma screening and high eye pressure management is done by Ophthalmology.
Sudden onset of floaters or flashes requires immediate Ophthalmology attention.
Macular degeneration screening is performed by Ophthalmology.
Chronic dry eye syndrome is managed by Ophthalmology.
Diabetic retinopathy screening is essential for patients seeing Ophthalmology.
Strabismus (crossed eyes) is corrected by Ophthalmology.
Retinal detachment requires emergency Ophthalmology surgery.
Recurring styes or chalazions are treated by Ophthalmology.
Pterygium (surfer's eye) growth is removed by Ophthalmology.
Uveitis or internal eye inflammation requires Ophthalmology.
Keratoconus (corneal thinning) is managed by Ophthalmology.
Color blindness testing is done by Ophthalmology.
Blepharitis (eyelid inflammation) is treated by Ophthalmology.
Sudden vision loss in one eye requires emergency Ophthalmology or Neurology.
Corrective laser eye surgery (LASIK) is performed by Ophthalmology.
Eye trauma or corneal abrasions are treated by Ophthalmology.
Double vision (diplopia) warrants evaluation by Ophthalmology or Neurology.
Night blindness requires Ophthalmology evaluation.
Severe eye strain or computer vision syndrome is managed by Ophthalmology.
Chronic migraines or cluster headaches require Neurology consultation.
Seizures or epilepsy management is led by Neurology.
Parkinson’s disease symptoms like tremors require Neurology.
Peripheral neuropathy causing foot numbness is treated by Neurology.
Alzheimer’s disease and dementia evaluation is done by Neurology.
Multiple Sclerosis (MS) flares are managed by Neurology.
Post-stroke rehabilitation and management is guided by Neurology.
Vertigo of central origin (brain-related) requires Neurology.
Restless Leg Syndrome (RLS) is treated by Neurology.
Bell’s Palsy (facial drooping) is evaluated by Neurology or ENT.
Trigeminal neuralgia (facial pain) is managed by Neurology.
Essential tremors are treated by Neurology.
Myasthenia Gravis causing muscle weakness requires Neurology.
Huntington’s disease genetic counseling and care involves Neurology.
ALS (Lou Gehrig's disease) is managed by Neurology.
Frequent fainting (syncope) not caused by the heart requires Neurology.
Confusion or sudden memory loss warrants Neurology evaluation.
Unexplained muscle weakness or atrophy is investigated by Neurology.
Speech difficulties (aphasia) require Neurology assessment.
Coordination or balance issues (ataxia) are evaluated by Neurology.
Chronic sinusitis that resists antibiotics requires ENT evaluation.
Recurrent tonsillitis often leads to an ENT consultation for removal.
Sudden hearing loss requires immediate ENT assessment.
Deviated septum causing nasal obstruction is corrected by ENT.
Hoarseness lasting more than two weeks requires ENT laryngoscopy.
Obstructive sleep apnea may require ENT surgery.
Frequent nosebleeds (epistaxis) are cauterized by ENT.
Difficulty swallowing (dysphagia) is evaluated by ENT or GI.
Thyroid nodules often require ENT or Endocrinology biopsy.
Ear tubes for recurrent ear infections are placed by ENT.
Perforated eardrum repair is performed by ENT.
Salivary gland stones or swelling are managed by ENT.
TMJ pain is sometimes evaluated by ENT or Oral Surgery.
Neck masses or lumps should be biopsied by ENT.
Loss of smell (anosmia) is investigated by ENT.
Loss of taste (ageusia) is evaluated by ENT.
Labyrinthitis or inner ear dizziness is treated by ENT.
Snoring issues are evaluated by ENT.
Foreign bodies lodged in the ear or nose are removed by ENT.
Vocal cord polyps or nodules are treated by ENT.
Heart palpitations or fluttering sensations require Cardiology.
Atrial fibrillation (irregular heartbeat) is managed by Cardiology.
Congestive heart failure symptoms like leg swelling need Cardiology.
High cholesterol refractory to diet requires Cardiology.
Resistant hypertension (high blood pressure) is managed by Cardiology or Nephrology.
Heart murmurs detected during exams require Cardiology echocardiogram.
Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD) causing leg cramps needs Cardiology.
Aortic aneurysm monitoring is done by Cardiology.
Unexplained fainting (syncope) often requires Cardiology workup.
History of heart attack requires ongoing Cardiology care.
Need for a pacemaker or defibrillator is assessed by Cardiology.
Varicose veins and venous insufficiency are treated by Cardiology or Vascular Surgery.
Pericarditis (inflammation of heart lining) is treated by Cardiology.
Endocarditis (heart valve infection) is managed by Cardiology and ID.
Cardiomyopathy (enlarged heart) is monitored by Cardiology.
Congenital heart defects are followed by Cardiology.
Positive stress test results require Cardiology catheterization.
Shortness of breath on exertion is evaluated by Cardiology or Pulmonology.
Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome (POTS) is managed by Cardiology.
Pre-operative cardiac clearance is performed by Cardiology.
Chronic acid reflux (GERD) is managed by Gastroenterology.
Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) is treated by Gastroenterology.
Crohn’s disease management requires Gastroenterology.
Ulcerative Colitis is treated by Gastroenterology.
Internal hemorrhoids causing bleeding are treated by Gastroenterology.
Gallstones causing colic often require Gastroenterology or Surgery.
Elevated liver enzymes require Gastroenterology investigation.
Hepatitis C treatment is managed by Gastroenterology or Hepatology.
Chronic pancreatitis is managed by Gastroenterology.
Chronic constipation unresponsive to fiber needs Gastroenterology.
Celiac disease diagnosis and management involves Gastroenterology.
Stomach ulcers (peptic ulcers) are treated by Gastroenterology.
Rectal bleeding requires colonoscopy by Gastroenterology.
Colon cancer screening (colonoscopy) is performed by Gastroenterology.
Fatty liver disease is monitored by Gastroenterology.
H. Pylori infection is treated by Gastroenterology.
Gastroparesis (slow stomach emptying) is treated by Gastroenterology.
Diverticulitis flare-ups are managed by Gastroenterology.
Barrett’s Esophagus monitoring is done by Gastroenterology.
Unexplained weight loss with digestive issues needs Gastroenterology.
Recurrent Urinary Tract Infections (UTIs) require Urology.
Kidney stones causing pain are managed by Urology.
Enlarged prostate (BPH) causing poor flow is treated by Urology.
Erectile dysfunction is evaluated by Urology.
Urinary incontinence is managed by Urology or Urogynecology.
Blood in the urine (hematuria) requires Urology cystoscopy.
Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) stages are managed by Nephrology.
Dialysis requirement is managed by Nephrology.
Protein in the urine (proteinuria) is investigated by Nephrology.
Bladder cancer screening and treatment is done by Urology.
Testicular pain or lumps require Urology evaluation.
Vasectomy procedures are performed by Urology.
Low testosterone (Hypogonadism) is treated by Urology or Endocrinology.
Overactive bladder symptoms are treated by Urology.
Interstitial Cystitis (painful bladder) is managed by Urology.
Phimosis (tight foreskin) is treated by Urology.
Hydrocele (scrotal swelling) is managed by Urology.
Polycystic Kidney Disease is monitored by Nephrology.
Severe electrolyte imbalances are corrected by Nephrology.
Glomerulonephritis is treated by Nephrology.
Pregnancy confirmation and prenatal care is led by OB/GYN.
Menopause symptoms like hot flashes are managed by OB/GYN.
Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) is managed by OB/GYN.
Endometriosis causing pelvic pain is treated by OB/GYN.
Abnormal Pap smear results require OB/GYN follow-up.
Uterine fibroids causing heavy bleeding are treated by OB/GYN.
Birth control consultation and IUD insertion is done by OB/GYN.
Infertility assessments are started by OB/GYN.
Recurrent yeast infections or BV are treated by OB/GYN.
Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID) is treated by OB/GYN.
Ovarian cysts are monitored by OB/GYN.
Mastitis in breastfeeding women is treated by OB/GYN.
Uterine prolapse is managed by OB/GYN or Urogynecology.
Heavy menstrual bleeding (menorrhagia) is treated by OB/GYN.
Irregular periods are investigated by OB/GYN.
Severe PMS or PMDD is managed by OB/GYN.
Adolescent gynecological exams are performed by OB/GYN.
Preconception counseling is provided by OB/GYN.
Postpartum depression screening is done by OB/GYN.
Pain during intercourse (dyspareunia) is evaluated by OB/GYN.
Major Depressive Disorder is managed by Psychiatry.
Generalized Anxiety Disorder is treated by Psychiatry.
Bipolar Disorder mood stabilization is managed by Psychiatry.
Schizophrenia and psychosis require Psychiatry.
Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD) is treated by Psychiatry.
PTSD trauma therapy is managed by Psychiatry.
ADHD medication management is handled by Psychiatry.
Eating disorders (Anorexia/Bulimia) are treated by Psychiatry.
Chronic insomnia is evaluated by Psychiatry or Sleep Medicine.
Substance addiction recovery is managed by Psychiatry.
Type 1 Diabetes management is led by Endocrinology.
Type 2 Diabetes uncontrolled by oral meds needs Endocrinology.
Hypothyroidism (Hashimoto's) is treated by Endocrinology.
Hyperthyroidism (Graves' disease) is treated by Endocrinology.
Adrenal fatigue or insufficiency is evaluated by Endocrinology.
Cushing’s syndrome (high cortisol) is treated by Endocrinology.
Growth hormone deficiency in children is managed by Endocrinology.
Metabolic bone disease is treated by Endocrinology.
Pituitary tumors or adenomas are managed by Endocrinology.
Gender-affirming hormone therapy is managed by Endocrinology.
Chest pain with burning sensation rising up the throat, worse after eating (GERD) differentiates from cardiac arrest and requires Gastroenterology.
Chest pain with heavy pressure or elephant sitting on chest, radiating to left arm indicates classic Angina/MI symptoms requiring Cardiology.
Sharp chest pain that worsens with deep breath (pleuritic pain) indicates Pleurisy or Pulmonary Embolism requiring Pulmonology.
Severe lower back pain with fever and difficult/painful urination indicates Kidney Infection (Pyelonephritis) requiring Urology.
Lower back pain radiating down the leg with foot numbness indicates Sciatica or Herniated Disc requiring Orthopedics.
Dizziness described as room spinning around (vertigo) indicates inner ear vestibular issue requiring ENT.
Dizziness with feeling faint or lightheaded when standing quickly indicates Orthostatic Hypotension or blood pressure issue requiring Cardiology.
Headache around eyes and cheeks with thick yellow nasal discharge indicates Sinusitis requiring ENT.
Severe throbbing one-sided headache with light sensitivity and nausea indicates Migraine requiring Neurology.
Sudden thunderclap headache described as worst headache of life indicates possible Aneurysm/Hemorrhage requiring Emergency Medicine or Neurology.
Fatigue with weight gain, hair loss, and feeling cold indicates Hypothyroidism requiring Endocrinology.
Fatigue with shortness of breath and pale skin indicates Anemia requiring Hematology.
Fatigue with loud snoring and gasping for air at night indicates Sleep Apnea requiring Sleep Medicine or Pulmonology.
Abdominal pain in lower right side worsening with movement indicates Appendicitis requiring General Surgery.
Upper right abdominal pain particularly after eating fatty foods indicates Gallstones requiring Gastroenterology.
Bilateral leg swelling with shortness of breath lying flat (orthopnea) indicates Congestive Heart Failure requiring Cardiology.
Unilateral leg swelling with redness, warmth, and pain indicates DVT (Deep Vein Thrombosis) requiring Vascular Surgery or Emergency care.
Joint pain with morning stiffness that improves with movement indicates Inflammatory Arthritis (RA) requiring Rheumatology.
Joint pain that worsens with use and improves with rest indicates Osteoarthritis (wear and tear) requiring Orthopedics.
Persistent cough with night sweats and unintended weight loss indicates Tuberculosis or Malignancy requiring Infectious Disease or Pulmonology.
Cough with facial pressure, headache, and thick nasal discharge indicates Sinusitis requiring ENT or Primary Care.
Cough with wheezing, chest tightness, and shortness of breath indicates Asthma or COPD requiring Pulmonology.
Productive cough with green or yellow sputum and fever indicates Bacterial Pneumonia requiring Pulmonology or Primary Care.
Coughing up blood (hemoptysis) even small amounts requires immediate Pulmonology or Emergency evaluation.
Chronic dry cough with heartburn, acid taste in mouth, or regurgitation indicates GERD-related cough requiring Gastroenterology.
Dry cough started after beginning ACE inhibitor medication (lisinopril, enalapril) indicates medication side effect requiring Cardiology.
Cough with shortness of breath when lying flat (orthopnea) and ankle swelling indicates Heart Failure requiring Cardiology.
Cough with itchy watery eyes, sneezing, and seasonal pattern indicates Allergic Rhinitis requiring Allergy/Immunology.
Cough with postnasal drip sensation and throat clearing indicates Upper Airway Cough Syndrome requiring ENT.
Chronic dry cough lasting more than 8 weeks without clear cause requires Pulmonology workup.
Cough with high fever, chills, body aches, and sudden onset indicates Influenza requiring Primary Care or Infectious Disease.
Cough worse with exercise or cold air with chest tightness indicates Exercise-Induced Bronchoconstriction requiring Pulmonology.
Barking cough in children with stridor (high-pitched breathing) indicates Croup requiring ENT or Pediatrics.
Chronic productive cough with large amounts of daily sputum indicates Bronchiectasis requiring Pulmonology.
Persistent cough in long-term smoker with weight loss and hoarseness indicates possible Lung Cancer requiring Oncology or Pulmonology.
